content: आकांक्ष {%<ab>a.</ab>%} {@--1@} Desiring, wishing. {@--2@} (In <ab>gram.</ab>) Requiring some words to complete the sense; अंगयुक्तं तिङाकांक्षं <ls>P. VIII. 2. 96</ls>, <ls n="P. VIII. 2.">104.</ls> --क्षा {@--1@} Desire, wish; भक्त° <ls>Suśr.</ls>, <ls>Amaru. 41.</ls> {@--2@} (In <ab>gram.</ab> &c.) The presence of a word necessary to complete the sense, one of the three elements necessary to convey a complete sense or thought (the other two being योग्यता and आसत्ति); आकांक्षा प्रतीतिपर्यवसानविरहः <ls>S. D. 2</ls> the absence of the completion of a sense; see <ls>Bhāṣā P. 82</ls>, <ls n="Bhāṣā P.">84</ls> and <ls>T. S. 49</ls>; in the ex. गौरश्वः पुरुषो हस्ती there is आकांक्षा. {@--3@} Looking at or towards. {@--4@} Purpose, intention. {@--5@} Inquiry. {@--6@} The significance of a word.
